Articles.Content:
Is anybody clicking cookies?

It's an addictive little game where you click a cookie to produce more cookies, which you then use to buy different cookie production upgrades.

http://orteil.dashnet.org/cookieclicker/

I'm currently producing a little more than half a billion cookies per second.
Thanks for wasting my evening. Now I have to beat your record.
That game spawned a whole legion of follow-ups. There's Adventure Capitalist, Clicker Heroes, Swarm Simulator or Time Clickers to name a few.

There is even an anime monster girl version called Sakura clicker. So very close to being a hentai game.

These games....it is like someone was trying to do a Skinner box experiment on human and figured out they can make money with it.

Pics or it didn't happen, right?

Note: The reason it started that long ago is because I started it that long ago. I haven't actually played for that long. XD
You just wasted my day, thank you.

Starwhip, you sure are serious about cookies.

How much do you have in the wrinklers?

As for you guys, complaining about me wasting your day, go and have a cookie.

I played this in 6th grade.

Just one more click... one more click...
I wonder...how many earths have to be conquered to get that many cookies?

That game spawned a whole legion of follow-ups. There's Adventure Capitalist, Clicker Heroes, Swarm Simulator or Time Clickers to name a few.

Yeah, I don't think so.

This is the grandfather of all these time wasting "projects".

Yeah, I don't think so.

This is the grandfather of all these time wasting "projects".

Just because a genre wasn't invented by a work doesn't mean that work didn't spawn descendents. Sherlock Holmes wasn't the first detective story, but it was the first super popular one. There were platforming games before Mario, and tragedies before Shakespeare. Do you know of them?

Wasn't this game a thing like in, what, 2013?

Pics or it didn't happen, right?

http://i.imgur.com/uSxRSPK.png

Note: The reason it started that long ago is because I started it that long ago. I haven't actually played for that long. XD

Congratulations! You deserve a golden star for all that hard and backbreaking effort you put into clicking a button endlessly.

Congratulations! You deserve a golden star for all that hard and backbreaking effort you put into clicking a button endlessly.

I know, right? So much work.

Not really, though. Actually I just let the game play itself, for the sake of curiosity. I wouldn't consider it an accomplishment, or work. There's a plugin that basically is an autopilot for the game. So I left it running overnight a few times...

Just because a genre wasn't invented by a work doesn't mean that work didn't spawn descendents. Sherlock Holmes wasn't the first detective story, but it was the first super popular one. There were platforming games before Mario, and tragedies before Shakespeare. Do you know of them?

TKEP was a very popular thing back in its time.

The difference is that TKEP has a goal - reduce the population to zero.

Baking cookies has no such limit.

Anyway, this is my status update. Still not near Starwhip, but I'm baking my bum off.
I wonder if we collect all the cookies that has been baked by all cookies clicker players, can we make a whole planet with its own gravity field out of cookie yet?

No...just...no...I shan't...I won't...I can't...not again...no clicks...no

It looks like I nuked my previous progress when I was having web browser problems. Once you get a good autoclicker it just ends up being idleRPG anyway.

Try not to cheat then.

No autoclickers, no optimization apps and plugins, just good old fashioned grandmas.

N-n-no... Last time I spent SO MUCH TIME on this game. Not again...

Been playing for about 5 minutes with a CPS of 10.
I prefer to bake real cookies. Tastier than RAM sticks and the smell's a lot better than anything that comes out of a fan vent. They also aren't horrendously copied without care or discretion.

Darn you. It's begun.

I presume there isn't a way to save progress to start it again from a different machine?
Have the app. Extremely addicting. Reason I'm not playing KSP right now.
This game is more fun than it should be. The numbers just keep. Getting. BIGGER!

Darn you. It's begun.

I presume there isn't a way to save progress to start it again from a different machine?

There is.

If you export the save as a text file, you can then save it and email it to yourself.

Go to Menu -> Export Save.

I've decided to let my game keep running in the background to see what happens.
Must get higher than ze portal!
